verses.verse: In those days, when there was a very large multitude, they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him and said,
"I have compassion on this crowd, because they have now been with me three days and have had nothing to eat,
and if I send them away fasting to their homes, they will get exhausted on the way, for some of them have come from far away."
His disciples answered him, "How can anyone satisfy these with bread here in the wilderness?"
Then he asked them, "How many loaves do you have?" And they said, "Seven."

He ordered the people to sit down on the ground, and he took the seven loaves and gave thanks, then broke [the loaves] and gave to his disciples to set before them, and they did set it before the people.
They also had a few small fish; he blessed and ordered to set that also before them.
So they ate and were filled, and they picked up seven baskets of leftovers.
Those who had eaten were about four thousand, and then he sent them away.
Immediately he entered a ship with his disciples and came into the region of Dalmanutha.
The Pharisees came out and started questioning him, seeking from him a sign from heaven. They were tempting him.
And he sighed deeply in his spirit and said, "Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly I say to you there will no sign be given to this generation."
And he left them and entering the ship again left for the other side.
Now [the disciples] had forgotten to take bread; neither did they have any in the ship with them except one loaf.
And he strongly warned them, "Look out, beware, of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod."
They talked it over with themselves saying that it was because we have no bread.
When Jesus knew about it, he said to them, "Why did you discuss how that you have no bread? Don't you understand yet, or is your heart still hard?
"Having eyes, don't you see? Having ears, don't you hear? Don't you remember?
"After I broke up the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of leftovers did you pick up?" They said to him, "Twelve."
"And after the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of leftovers did you pick up?" And they said, "Seven."
Then he said to them, "How is it then that you do not catch on?"
And he came to Bethsaida, and they brought a blind man to him and pled with him to touch him.
And he took the blind man by the hand and led him out of town. After he had spit on his eyes and put his hands on him, he asked him if he saw anything.
He looked up and said, "I see men like trees, walking."
After that he put hands on his eyes again and made him look up, and he was restored and saw every one clearly.
He sent him away to his house saying, "Do not go into the town or talk about it to anyone in the town."
Jesus and his disciples went out to the towns of Caesarea, Philippi, and along the way he asked his disciples saying to them, "Whom do people say that I am?"
They replied, "John the Baptist, but some say Elijah and others one of the prophets."
And he said to they, "But who do you say I am?" And Peter answered and said to him, "You are the Messiah."
He ordered them that they should tell no one about him.
He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed and after three days rise again.
He told this message openly, but Peter took him and started to rebuke him.
But after he had turned around and looked at his disciples, he rebuked Peter saying, "Get behind me, Satan, for you are not thinking about the things of God but the things of men."
After he had called the people along with his disciples, too, he said to them, "Whosoever has made up his mind to follow me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and go together with me.
"For whosoever makes up his mind to save his life, will lose it, but whosoever will lose for my sake and the gospel's, will save it.
"For how will it profit a man, if he will gain the whole world, yet lose his own soul?
"Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
"Therefore whosoever will be ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels."
